Class ShapeTool

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component

                      edu.bu.segrelab.comets.AbstractTool
                          edu.bu.segrelab.comets.ShapeTool
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class ShapeTool
extends AbstractTool

The ShapeTool is a part of the tool palette used in modifying the initial layout in the CometsSetupPanel.

With this tool selected the user can draw a shape of biomass and media on the layout panel. This is done by clicking and dragging to select the area covered by the shape, then releasing to populate that shape with biomass or media.

This tool's control panel allows the user to make either a square or circular shape, with stroke width between 1 and 10 spaces, with this choice of whether or not to fill the shape.

Author:
Bill Riehl
See Also:
Serialized Form
